com.google.ase
Class BluetoothService

java.lang.Object
  com.google.ase.BluetoothService

public class BluetoothService
extends java.lang.Object

This class does all the work for setting up and managing Bluetooth connections with other devices. It has a thread that listens for incoming connections, a thread for connecting with a device, and a thread for performing data transmissions when connected.

Method Detail

getState

public int getState()
Return the current connection state.

start

public void start(java.util.UUID uuid)
Start the Bluetooth service. Specifically start AcceptThread to begin a session in listening (server) mode.

connect

public void connect(BluetoothDevice device,
                    java.util.UUID uuid)
Start the ConnectThread to initiate a connection to a remote device.

Parameters:
device - The BluetoothDevice to connect

connected

public void connected(BluetoothSocket socket,
                      BluetoothDevice device)
Start the ConnectedThread to begin managing a Bluetooth connection.

Parameters:
socket - The BluetoothSocket on which the connection was made
device - The BluetoothDevice that has been connected
